channel.title: Computer Question
channel.description:
Well, I got a new computer and I'm having a little problem.....
There is this awful annoying damn CAPS lock message/image appearing on the center of the screen when I turn it off/on, I was wondering how I would turn this off?
Of course I'm using Google to figure it out as well but if someone has some instant tips on how to disable it, I'll appreciate it!

item.title: Computer Question
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

SilentCJ:

Pretty sure it’s the quickset.exe application for mine, only problem is when that’s disabled, my keyboard touch controls for volume and disc ejecting then don’t work.

Afraid not, mine is a Samsung and I’ve looked for that process.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Question
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Team_Rocket:

I’m pretty sure you can’t remove this. You might try turning off start programs until you get the right one.

Pretty sure it’s the quickset.exe application for mine, only problem is when that’s disabled, my keyboard touch controls for volume and disc ejecting then don’t work.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

I’m pretty sure you can’t remove this. You might try turning off start programs until you get the right one.

item.description:

Mine does the same, any chance that it’s a dell computer?
